lines.content: * Duke class that simulates the running of the Duke Program
/** Storage instance that is used by Duke during run for loading and writing of file*/
/** TaskList instance used by Duke during run that manages the tasks */
/** Ui instance used by Duke during run to interact with User */
* Runs the Duke Program. The Duke Program will watch for user input and react accordingly to the
* main driver method to run the Duke program
* The Parser class parses is a class which parses the user input
* to check if the user input is valid
* If the user input is invalid, an exception will be thrown
/** Action input from user that is parsed into an array for checking */
* Constructor to initialize the Parser object
* Constructor to initialize the Parser object with given action
* @param  action action refers to the user input when Duke asks what it should do
* Checks the input and validates it
* @throws MissingTaskInputException if adding task command has missing input
* @throws DukeIncompleteInputException if command has incomplete input
* @throws UnknownInputException if input is not recognized by duke
public void check() throws MissingTaskInputException, DukeIncompleteInputException {
* Returns the result of the action parsed by the parser
* @return A string array containing the parsed user input
* Storage class that is used for the reading and writing of the list file
/** Filewriter instance used to write into the file */
/** File instance that will be used to load file */
/** Scanner instance that will be used to load file contents into Duke */
* Storage class constructor to initialize the Storage object
* Returns a arraylist of String objects that will be used to load the TaskList
* Writes into the current TaskList into file
* @throws DukeOnlyIOException when there is a IOException
public void write(TaskList list) throws DukeOnlyIOException {
* TaskList class contains a list in which stores all the tasks that the user has inputted and not deltted
* TaskList constructor to intialize a new empty TaskList
* TaskList constructor to intialize a new TaskList with a given ArrayList of tasks
* the tasks are all stored as string format which is processed before being
* added to the current task list
* Adds a task to the task list
* Returns The task inside the task list at the index specified
* @param index index of task inside the tasklist
* Returns a ToDoTask based on the user input and adds it to the list
* @param action  The string action input by the user
* Returns a EventTask based on the user input and adds it to the list
* @param action  The string action input by the user
* Returns a DeadLineTask based on the user input and adds it to the list
* @param action  The string action input by the user
* Returns A task that is mark as done
* The task at the specified index is
* marked as done before being returned
* @param index index of task in list
* Returns the task that was at specified index is now removed.
* @param index index of Task in list
* Returns The String that will be used to write into the file.
* @return A string to be written into the file.
* Returns a String containing the tasks that have this date
* @param date the date to search for
* @return A string of tasks to be printed
* Returns a List of tasks that match the keyword inputted
* @param keyword the keyword to search for in the tasks
* @return the list of tasks which contain that keyword
* UI class that is responsible for reading user input and printing
* Constructor to initialize the UI Class
* Returns A string which is the user input.
String INTRODUCTION = "     Hello! I'm Duke\n" + "     What can I do for you?";
String FAREWELL = "     Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";
* Prints the message when a task is added.
String PRINT_ADD_TASK = "     Got it. I've added this task: ";
* Prints the error when attempting to load file message.
String UNABLE_TO_LOAD = "     Unable to load file. Creating new one";
* Prints out the number of tasks inside the TaskList
String COUNT_TASKS_MESSAGE = "     Now you have " + list.getList().size() + " tasks in the list.";
* Prints the message when a task is removed.
String REMOVE_TASK_MESSAGE = "     Noted. I've removed this task: ";
* Prints the message when a task is marked.
String TASK_MARKED_MESSAGE =  "     Nice! I've marked this task as done:";
* @param list the Task list to be printed
* Prints out the current task list
* Prints out the number of tasks inside the TaskList on list command.
String TASKS_LIST_MESSAGE = "     Here are the tasks in your list:";
* Prints out the matching message when user is finding for a keyword in the list
String PRINT_MATCHING_MESSAGE = "     Here are the matching tasks in your list: ";
* DukeException class is a class for all the exceptions thrown
* during execution of the Duke program
* It inherit from the Java exception class
* DukeException constructor used to initialize the Exception
* DukeFileNotFoundException class is a class for all the exceptions thrown
* when the file to load cannot be found
* It inherit from the DukeException class
* DukeIncompleteInputException class is a class for all the exceptions thrown
* Caused by a command that does not add a task to the task list
* during execution of the Duke program
* It inherit from the Java DukeException class
* DukeException constructor used to initialize the Exception
* @param action causing the exception to be thrown
* DukeOnlyIOException class is a class for all the IO exceptions thrown during Duke
* It inherit from the DukeException class
* DukeOnlyIOException constructor used to initialize the Exception
* MissingTaskInputException class is a class for all the exceptions thrown when
* A task related command is inputted but there is incomplete input
* MissingTaskInput class constructor to initialize an instance
* @param action the action causing the exception to be thrown
super("     ☹ OOPS!!! The description of a " + action + " cannot be empty.");
* UnknownInputException class is a class for all the exceptions thrown
* when Duke faces an input it does not know
* It inherit from the DukeException class
super("     ☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* DetailTask class models an actual task that the user is about to do or has completed
* with a given deadline. It also inherits from the Task class.
/** The deadline of the deadline task */
* Constructor to initalize a Deadline Task
* @param description the description of the task
* Returns the deadline of the task formatted to be dd-MM-YYYY
* Returns the deadline of the deadline task formatted to be dd-MM-YYYY.
* Returns the deadline as a LocalDate Object
* toString method of DeadlineTask which prints out details of the deadline task
* EventTask class models an actual task that the user is about to do or has completed
* with a given timing of the task. It also inherits from the Task class.
* @param description the description of the EventTask
* Returns the timing of the event task formatted to be dd-MM-YYYY
* Returns the timing of the event task formatted to be dd-MM-YYYY.
* Returns the timing of the event task as a LocalDate
* toString method of EventTask which prints out details of the EventTask
* Task class models an actual task that the user is about to do or has completed
* Its details include the description as well as the type of the task
/** status on whether task is completed */
* @param description the description of the task
* Returns a String icon based on whether task has been completed
* Returns the status icon with enclosing brackets
* Sets a task to be done
* toString method of Task which prints out details of the task
* TodoTask class models an actual task that the user is about to do or has completed
* It also inherits from the Task class.
* @param description the description of the EventTask
* toString method of ToDoTask which prints out details of the ToDoTask
# create bin directory if it doesn't exist
# compile the code into the bin folder, terminates if error occurred
# run the program, feed commands from input.txt file and redirect the output to the ACTUAL.TXT
# compare the output to the expected output
